categories: Category:Articles that are known by a nickname

nodes.text: X-5 was a Human male assassin who, along with six other men, was hired by Commander Rezi Soresh to participate in Project Omega. The operation was an experiment by the Galactic Empire to create the perfect assassin. Soresh cleared the participants' identities from a computer database system and had their faces surgically altered. He then started his brutal reconditioning program, which was designed to turn them into mindless servants by removing their past memories and emotions.

At first, X-5 became friends with X-1, X-2, X-3, X-4, X-6, and X-7, the other participants in the training program. However, after Soresh started torturing them with electrocution, X-5, like the others, had his personality and mind changed completely until he felt no emotions. Around ten years prior to the Battle of Yavin, the trainees were pitted against each other until only one remained. X-5 malfunctioned and began muttering about alliances. He encouraged the others to see Soresh as their enemy. Just before all of X-7's emotions had gone, he killed X-5, earning the right to become Soresh's personal assassin.

X-5's only appearance in Star Wars canon is in a flashback in Rebel Force: Target, the first book of the young readers series Star Wars: Rebel Force, published on December 2, 2008 and written by Alex Wheeler.
